description:
Mr. H is currently exploring the country of Bugindia, 
which consists of multiple cities connected by one-way roads
He's interested in discovering the shortest paths that form a 
cycle in the road network for each city. In simpler terms, he 
wants to know the length of the shortest route that starts from 
a city, travels through various cities, and eventually returns 
to the same city.

Mr. H is curious about this for every city in Bugindia, so he's 
asked for your help in calculating these shortest path lengths.

Store N lintegers, the length of shortest path which begins in city i and ends in city i in a list or vector. If there is no path then its value is -1.
Constraints 

0 < N ≤ 2000, the number of cities.

0 ≤ roads[i][j] ≤ 1. 

One means, that there is a road between i and j (zero means there isn't a road).
title: Mr.H in Bugindia
